You always wanted to be a pro. Here’s your chance to make it big. In the Navy. 
Today’s Navy is where it’s happen­ing. Action. Adventure. Advance­ment. Alife of challenge; a rewarding career. You’ll go places other peo­ple only dream about. In a man’s world where the only thing that counts is ability. 
Come play The Navy Game. With more than 250 different education opportunities—in exciting new fields like electronics, data processing, and atomic power—we’ll make you 
a pro. 

What are you waiting for? Call your 
local Navy Recruiter today, or write: Navy Game 157-4 
Navy Yard, D.C. 20390 
Ifyou’re goingto be something, why not be something special?

OPERATING 



OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS FOR CENTREX 
NOTRE DAME AND ST. MARY’S CAMPUS CALLS: Dial the 4 digit extension number. 
LOCAL CALLS: Dial “9” then the seven digit number. 
CAMPUS DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: If not listed in directory -Dial “0”. 

ST. MARY’SDIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: Consult St. Mary’sDirectory - If not listed -Dial “0”. 
LOCAL DIRECTORY ASSISTANCE: Dial “9” -then 113. 

REPAIR AND ASSISTANCE: If your telephone is not working properly, or you need assistance with a call -Dial “0”. 
DIRECTORY CHANGES: Directory changes should be reported as they occur to Personnel Department. Changes include additions, deletions, number changes, corrections in Directory, etc. 
TO TRANSFER CALLS: Incoming calls ONLY may be transferred. Depress the receiver hook 1 time and release the operator will answer and you give her your request. 
WHEN OFF CAMPUS DIALING CAMPUS NUMBERS1. Dial ALL seven digits. If you do not know the num­ber, dial the Notre Dame listed number -283-6011. 
LONG DISTANCE-DIRECT DISTANCE DIALING: Dial “9”. Dial “1”. 
Dial the area code. Then dial the seven digit number. 
STUDENTS: GIVE THE OPERATOR YOUR SPECIAL BILLING NUMBER WHEN REQUESTED. 
ADMINISTRATIVE: GIVE THE OPERATOR THE NUMBER ASSIGNED TO YOU WHEN REQUESTED. 
TO REACH THE LONG DISTANCE OPERATOR: Dial “9” then “0”. 
CONFERENCE CALLS: Conference calls can be placed from any station on 
campus by dialing “55” for the conference operator. It is possible to have five conferees on one conference call. 
SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR STUDENTS: Long Distance Collect calls incoming are not to be accepted from any source. A penalty of $5.00 will be assessed by the Universtiy for each collect toll call accepted by a student. 
TO REPORT AN EMERGENCY: Dial 6600 in case of serious accident or illness and give the dispatcher 
1. 
Location of victim. 

2. 
Name of victim, if known. 

3. 
Name of calling party. 

4. 
Extension number of calling party. 


IN MAKING ANY CALL BE SURE TO WAIT FOR THE DIAL TONE. DIAL EACH DIGIT CAREFULLY. 
EMERGENCY NUMBERS

I. M. Equipment Issue Room 
Events in the MONOGRAM ROOM AND MEETING ROOMS do not restrict utilization of any other area of the building. The only restriction would be a restriction of traffic in and aboutthe area of the Monogram Room and Meeting Rooms. 
Events in the CONCOURSE donot restrict utilization of any other area ofthe building. The only restriction wouldbe arestriction of traffic in and about the area of the Concourse. 
Events in the AUXILIARYGYMdo not restrict utilization of any other area of the building. The only restriction wouldbe arestriction of traffic in about the area of the Auxiliary Gym. 
Events in the FENCINGGYMdo not restrict utilization of any other area of the building. The only restriction would be a restriction of traffic in and about the area of the Fencing Gym. 
***A&CC Monitor willbe stationed in centralissue area to open handbaU and squash courts for those players who have made prior arrangements to use them.

It's the Marine Corps’ test for the 
man who wants responsibility and leadership from the start, not at some obscure point in his 
Takeyour 
barexam 

future. And there isn't a tougher test you could take—for the 
Marines don't choose their new
next 
summer 

officers lightly. Two six week sessions at Quantico—or one ten week session—will tell them and you if you’ve got all it takes to lead some of the world's best fighting men. If you do, you’ll pin on your lieutenant’s bars after 
college graduation, and carry new weight on your shoulders from that moment on.

Let the FIRST BANK TRAVEL BUREAU make your trip arrangements ... you don't even have to leave your room . . . just call our campus number 7080 (off campus 283-7080). 
Or visit our campus travel office in Badin Hall next to the Barber Shop. 
FIRST BANK TRAVEL BUREAU provides complete foreign and domestic travel service right on campus. Alone or in a group .. . First Bank gets you there and back ... easy. 
If your club, organization or class is considering a trip, do yourself a favor. Let us give you a price quote on the travel and arrange­ments at no cost. We will meet with you or your committee personally.

It’s the Marine Corps’test for the man who wants responsibility and leadership fromthe start, not atsome obscure point in his future. And there isn’tatougher test you could take—for the 
Marines don’tchoose their new officers lightly. Two six week sessions at Quantico—orone ten week session—will tell them and you if you’ve got all ittakes to lead some of the world’s best fighting men. Ifyou do, you’ll pin on yourlieutenant’s bars after college graduation, and carry new weight on your shoulders from that moment on. 
Ask 
Talk to the Marine Officer who visits yourcampus
